events.title: First Case in US and WA
events.content: The first confirmed recorded case in the US comes from Snohomish County in Washington State.

events.title: First Death in US and WA
events.content: The first confirmed recorded death in the US comes from King County in Washington State.

events.title: King County Reports New Cases
events.content: King County reports 14 new infections with 5 new deaths. Retroactive adjustments were made for infections missed.

events.title: Seattle State of Emergency
events.content: With growing infections and deaths, Seattle Mayor Jenny Durkan declares a state of emergency

events.title: Coronavirus is a Pandemic and start of lockdown
events.content: The WHO declares the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic. Washington Governor, Jay Inslee, bans gatherings of more than 250 people.

events.title: Continued lockdowns
events.content: With 772 confirmed cases and 42 deaths, Inslee announces all entertainment and recreational facilities will be closing - including bars, restaraunts, and gyms.

events.title: Phases for reopening annouced
events.content: Governor Inslee announces an extension of WA state stay-home order and annouces a county level phased reopening strategy.

events.title: King County cleared for Pahe 1.5
events.content: Governor Inslee approves King County to immediatly move to a Phase 1.5.
